ratings.question_text: What percentage of the reading and other assignments did you complete?

narratives.question_text: How well was the course organized?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: How effective was the balance between instruction and discussion?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: How well did the assigned papers, reports or other projects reflect the aims of the course?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: How did the amount of assigned reading work with weekly discussion?
comments: Paul is very sensitive to how busy we are, and assigns reading accordingly. Once or twice, though, I did feel that we could have read an additional play for class, because we ran out of things to discuss before it was time to go.

If memory serves, Paul himself didn't bring in a lot of supplementary materials like videos or recordings. But students brought in video clips, etc. for their presentations. This was a great way to get to know the material.

narratives.question_text: The course filled a significant gap in your knowledge of the field.
comments: We covered so much wonderful information in this course. It was especially good because Paul focused on the various performance, rather than simply literary, traditions of the Middle Ages.

narratives.question_text: Regardless of whether or not the course is required, would you recommend it to other students in and outside the department?
comments: Yes. Paul is an excellent professor and makes it a point to get to know the students on an individual basis and meet them where they are at (all kinds of knowledge levels and backgrounds). Class discussion was always lively and everyone felt inclined to contribute to the growing knowledge base we were building around medieval drama.
Absolutely. Paul is one of the most brilliant, most dedicated teachers I have ever come across. Anyone would do well to take a class with him.

narratives.question_text: The course goals were clearly presented.
comments: Paul introduced them at the very beginning of the semester and returned to them at the end.

narratives.question_text: The instructor has a strong grasp of the course subject matter.
comments: It's clear that Paul read volumes upon volumes in preparation for this course. Each week, he came to class having reread the material, often ready to start nuanced discussions about specific passages in texts. He also often had specific questions in mind before class, which allowed us to have focused, intellectually stimulating conversations.

narratives.question_text: The instructor presented the subject matter effectively.
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: The instructor was willing to consider diverse points of view.
comments: Absolutely. Paul truly welcomes differences in opinion in the classroom.

narratives.question_text: The instructor was willing to answer pertinent questions.
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: The grading criteria was clearly explained.
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: The instructor was available for consultation, discussion and advice.
comments: Paul is the most available of all professors!!
Paul is always willing to meet and talk with students, even on short notice. I've suggested as much above, but I'll say it again: his level of commitment to his students is truly remarkable.

narratives.question_text: I would recommend this instructor to other students.
comments: YES!
Absolutely.

narratives.question_text: How many of the 14 class meetings did you attend?  Comments:
comments: All
I attended all of them.

narratives.question_text: Please offer additional comments you have on such topics as: what worked best about the course, what improvements you would suggest, etc.
comments: Excellent syllabus. Maybe less York Cycle? But who knows...it's an important Cycle!

I cannot stress enough how wonderful Paul is as a professor. I would only ask for one change to the way he ran the classroom. Each student had to do a presentation on the topic of their choice. The problem is that the length of time allotted to each presentation wasn't very well-defined. Some ran for ten minutes, others twenty, and still others closer to forty. Presenting information within a specified time limit is an important skill to have, and Paul could have explained more clearly how long each presentation should last.
